pull.title: Pass mempool reference to chainstate constructor
pull.body:
Next step toward #19556 

Instead of relying on the mempool global, each chainstate is given a reference to a mempool to keep up to date with the tip (block connections, disconnections, reorgs, ...)

events.message: Pass mempool reference to chainstate constructor

issue.title: refactor: Keep mempool interface in validation
issue.body:
Next step toward #19556 

Instead of relying on the mempool global, each chainstate is given an optional mempool to keep up to date with the tip (block connections, disconnections, reorgs, ...)

events.body:
Concept ACK

Will review / test soon.

edit: didn't want to make it an "approve" review...

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19306 (refactor: Replace RecursiveMutex with Mutex in CTxMemPool by hebasto)
* #18731 (refactor: Make CCheckQueue RAII-styled by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: refactor: Replace RecursiveMutex with Mutex in CTxMemPool
issue.body:
This PR replaces `RecursiveMutex CTxMemPool::cs` with `Mutex CTxMemPool:cs`.

All of the related code branches are covered by appropriate lock assertions to insure that the mutex locking policy has not been changed by accident

Related to #19303.

issue.title: refactor: Make CCheckQueue RAII-styled
issue.body:
This PR:
- makes `CCheckQueue` RAII-styled
- gets rid of two global variables:
  - `scriptcheckqueue`
  - `g_parallel_script_checks`

This PR is based on #18710, therefore only the last two commits should be considered.

events.body:
ACK fa0572d0f3b083b4c8e2e883a66e2b198c6779f1

Reviewed, and tested against https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18766 rebased on top of (a rebased version of) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19556.
A nice upside of using a reference is that if you intend to do the same [for the node context's mempool](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19556/commits/69154b90ae5aa1dda2505afa8f2ca6f45067d689#diff-5fdc6cba4c769cf3b49abadb4fa4593dR37), it would substantially simplify  #18766 :).
ACK fa0572d0f3b083b4c8e2e883a66e2b198c6779f1, reviewed and tested on Linux Mint 20 (x86_64).

comments.body: No it can stay, but here `LOCK2` doesn't support pointers or interfaces, so if someone wants to pick up #19629 again, `LOCK(cs_main)` will likely end up to be separate anyway.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -370,9 +370,10 @@ static bool IsCurrentForFeeEstimation() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
  * and instead just erase from the mempool as needed.
  */
 
-static void UpdateMempoolForReorg(DisconnectedBlockTransactions& disconnectpool, bool fAddToMempool) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main, ::mempool.cs)
+static void UpdateMempoolForReorg(CTxMemPool& mempool, DisconnectedBlockTransactions& disconnectpool, bool fAddToMempool) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main, mempool.cs)
comments.body:
While touching this line maybe explicitly mention the global namespace for `cs_main`:
```suggestion
static void UpdateMempoolForReorg(CTxMemPool& mempool, DisconnectedBlockTransactions& disconnectpool, bool fAddToMempool)
    EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(::cs_main, mempool.cs)
```
?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2485,8 +2486,11 @@ void static UpdateTip(const CBlockIndex* pindexNew, const CChainParams& chainPar
   * disconnectpool (note that the caller is responsible for mempool consistency
   * in any case).
   */
-bool CChainState::DisconnectTip(BlockValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, DisconnectedBlockTransactions *disconnectpool)
+bool CChainState::DisconnectTip(BlockValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, DisconnectedBlockTransactions* disconnectpool)
 {
+    AssertLockHeld(cs_main);

comments.body:
nit:
```suggestion
    bool DisconnectTip(BlockValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, DisconnectedBlockTransactions* disconnectpool)
        EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(::cs_main, m_mempool.cs);
```

nit:
```suggestion
    bool ActivateBestChainStep(BlockValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, bool& fInvalidFound, ConnectTrace& connectTrace)
        EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(::cs_main, m_mempool.cs);
    bool ConnectTip(BlockValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexNew, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, ConnectTrace& connectTrace, DisconnectedBlockTransactions& disconnectpool)
        EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(::cs_main, m_mempool.cs);
```
